name: Ramada Statesville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is under extensive renovation but is clean and well-managed by new ownership. It is nicely landscaped, with a pool and garden in center court. We asked for a different room because somebody had been smokng in a non-smoking room. The second room was quite acceptable, with a new ceiling and fresh-painted walls. Good AC, refrigerator and microwave. Other furnishings adequate-to-very good. Good linens.Newly renovated bath. New TV. The complimentary breakfast was well-managed in spacious, pleasant surroundings. Fresh food arrived as needed. The coffee was excellent. One nice touch. Plastic flatware came from a dispenser; no fishing through a basket. This place pays attention to detail.
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the final leg of our lengthy vaction, we chose Statesville, NC, because it was approximatedy three hours from our home--a decent, liesurely drive on up I-77. We chose the Ramada Inn based on their reputation and because we were getting tired of eating out of restaurants. They promised a "free" breakfast including scrambled eggs and breakfast meats. They delivered on neither. We got hard boiled eggs and burnt biscuits instead (the gravy was pretty good). Basically the breakfast was pretty much what you'd find in any such hotel--quite continental.
reviews.title: Unexceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the hotel on the Internet and called. The rate they offered on the phone was significantly higher than that of their own website. When I mentioned this, I was told, "the rates are always higher over the phone." So, I went back to their website and made our reservations at the lower rate. Is this any way to run a hotel? This Ramada was being remodeled and renovated (completion date, end of June, 2012), mostly the lobby and pool (which was closed). That we could live with. Neither effected our stay.
reviews.title: Horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked for and got a room with a king bed for $67 including taxes. The room was comfortable, clean, and roomy, though one would think, with only one (albeit somewhat larger) bed, the resulting extra space would be outfitted with extra furniture. It wasn't. Again, no big deal, just a curious fact.
reviews.title: Nice place to take a break from driving

reviews.text: Statesville is not a big city. Yet they have dozens and dozens of restaurants of every possible stripe and color; though apparently Statesvillans are highly partial to pizza, which made up at least HALF the listings. Given this, it's little wonder a modest place like the Ramada has trouble making an in-house restaurant (called "Sassy's") fly. Yet, if you want to stand out from the crowd, you offer something extra, you strive to be exceptional. Sadly, the Ramada Statesville does neither.
reviews.title: This hotel was disgusting and dirty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had we not pre-paid I would have turned around on seeing the building site that is the lobby.
reviews.title: Work in progress

reviews.text: This property, as previously stated is in the throes of a major makeover - despite appearances the manager thinks all should have been completed by mid-July.
reviews.title: Nice for the price

reviews.text: Last week the lobby was in turmoil, the restaurant and pool closed.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, quiet and clean rooms, what more can you ask for.

reviews.text: What it did have was very comfortable beds, good PROPERLY IRONED (this must be a first for this grade of hotel in USA and a real treat) bed linen and good towels.. Food was served in the noisy sports bar and my husband said his reasonably priced steak was good.
reviews.title: Best Hotel by Far!

reviews.text: As previously stated we found the breakfast awful but then 'biscuits & gravy' do nothing for us. Probably best to pay a few $ more and eat elsewhere. The rooms are a good size and, in view of the ongoing building clean but appeared to have been furnished rather than designed. There is a 'fridge and, I guess will be a microwave although the one in our room was not fitted.
reviews.title: Too expensive for a run down hotel.

reviews.text: From the parking, to the lower portion at the front desk, wide isles in bar and restaurant along with super accommodating staff.a sincere thank you The hotel room was clean, fresh,and easy to manoeuvre around . The handicap features of the wash room could not have been any better for ease of of use.Finally it would be remiss of me not to remind wheelchair users you do not have to leave the premises for dinner I enjoyed my chopped Angus sirloin. (with a couple of drinks being Irish you know) I will bring my wife back in June mainly for the included breakfast bar which you will not find anywhere with more selection and also for the fact it is half way back to my town in Canada Every staff member I met was more than obliging. Again thanks I'll be back don m
reviews.title: Great wheelchair accesability

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here many times through the years, through a few owners and countless management teams. It has never been bad, but this time was definitely the best. The front desk staff was super-friendly, both at night and the next morning, as were the bartender and the housekeepers. And the price is hard to beat for what you get.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

reviews.text: The room was immaculate -- definitely better than ever. Clean surfaces, clean floors, clean bathroom, comfy bed, coffee. The hallways do still have a hint of smokiness from the old days, but it's obvious that efforts have been made to freshen the air and quiet the atmosphere.
reviews.title: Nice try but had to leave due to bugginess

reviews.text: A couple of slight disappointments: HBO and PPV were "out of order," only 4 pillows (standard hotel size/weight pillows, so like 2 normal pillows) on a king bed; and the hotel bar closed at 11 p.m. People who arrive late are the ones who need it the most!
reviews.title: Execllent!!!

reviews.text: We did have a problem with the breakfast staff. We overslept and got there in the last 15 minutes of the buffet. We would have understood if they were out of food or couldn't serve us, but the apathy they displayed was really uncalled for. There was still cereal, so we shouldn't have to ask five times for a spoon. The cook told us (and several other latecomers) that they were totally out of hot food, only to produce fresh batches when prompted by the manager -- but with such a nasty attitude that there was no way we were eating it then. When the manager left, the server and cook had a loud, lengthy discussion about the faults of management and other staff members and how glad they were not to be working in "this hellhole" the next day. When another couple showed up late, saw the rude expressions, and walked away, the cook and server laughed. It was not a hospitable situation at all. They had to have been there several hours already ... why not be polite for another 10 minutes and not ruin someone's morning?
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: I wanted to make sure that my review was written. I left my laptop and my sons medications and machine out in the parking lot while i was loading up my van. I arrived home 10 hours later and to my dismay i noticed the lost items..I quickly called the hotel and to my surprise, housekeeping had found it and returned it to management. I spoke with the owner and manager and i am just shocked that this level of honesty still exists (by the way they are packing it up and shipping it back to me!) the hotel was a great experience, clean and quiet. I also was treated like class by the waitress as I needed some plastic forks..she was first class! this place is a gem..it has a nice little tavern where I watched espn and enjoyed a nice cold beer. The location is great if variety is what you want for foods, gas and stores...by the way it is very safe! you will be very happy to stay the night
reviews.title: Trust worthy kind staff and a great stay!

reviews.text: Everything is new from the beds to the towels and even the pillows. Great lounge &the restaurant. Staff is friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ramada Statesville was a bit strange. Firstly, when we opened the front door we noticed there was a handwritten note taped to it saying no vacancies. We'd made a reservation the night before so we proceeded to the front desk. No one was there. After awhile a pleasant man came to check us in. While he was doing this someone phoned and we heard him say there were 15 vacancies, the opposite of what it said on the front door. As we walked to our room we noticed the rugs needed cleaning and overall the place was a bit shabby; therefore, we were surprised to find our room was clean and quite large. Also the bedding was of a very high quality as were the toiletries in the bathroom. The bed proved to be very comfortable. We had a good night's sleep. The next morning we went to breakfast at 8:15. The breakfast was scheduled to end at 9. There wasn't much food left. There were no utensils or coffee cups. The three staff members were yelling and laughing with each other. It was hard for us to get their attention. When I asked for a coffee cup I was told that the woman to whom I spoke was the cook and didn't bring out cups. Another woman came out with 6 cups. Soon they'd been used. Why they didn't bring out a tray of coffee cups for a breakfast group didn't make sense to us. The staff continued to loudly interact with each other. My husband left the buffet and had breakfast later at a restaurant. The motel IS economical and the beds are comfortable with nice linens but the overall experience was a bit strange.
reviews.title: Odd Motel

reviews.text: Outside appearance very good. Hotel lobby very good. Front desk staff very nice. In fact, all staff were friendly and pleasant.
reviews.title: Must be a reason why its not a Holiday Inn anymore

reviews.text: Rooms on the other hand leave something to be desired. First room reaked of mildew. Bathroom had pink mould growing in it, bathroom fan didn't work so obviously the shower moisture cant be sucked out and just ends up in the room....
reviews.title: Thanks for the recomendation!

description: The Ramada Inn Hotel Statesville. Conveniently located in beautiful North Carolina. Just hours to the beach and even closer to the Blue Ridge mountains. The hotel is located in historic Statesville near the major interchange of I-40 & I-77. Upscale hotel with marble floored entrance way We have beautiful meeting spaces to accommodate any size meeting from 2-250 attendees. The hotel is equipped with wireless high speed Internet access, 134 rooms on 2 floors, inside entrance to the guestrooms, Full Service Restaurant, Room Service, Lounge and outdoor pool free guest laundry. Rooms include a king bed or two double beds and one suite. This hotel's motto is do 'Whatever it Takes' to satisfy our guests.
